message.content:
cs.SI, cs.SOC, cs.AI, cs.CYBER, cs.MA 

The paper uses an agent-based simulation to model attitude change arising from political dialogues, which involves social interactions and cognitive processes. Therefore, the most likely category is cs.SI (Social and Information Networks). The paper also discusses the emergence of macroscopic phenomena from the interactions of agents, which suggests a possible fit with cs.SOC (Social and Behavioral Sciences). The use of multiple heuristics for reevaluating and expressing opinions involves artificial intelligence techniques, which could place the paper in cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence). The paper also discusses the effects of preference falsification, which could relate to cs.CYBER (Cybersecurity and Privacy) or cs.MA (Multiagent Systems).
